fields.value: Replication data for: Measuring Citizen and Government Ideology in the American States, 1960-93

dsDescriptionValue.value: We construct dynamic measures of the ideology of a state's citizens and political leaders, using the roll call voting scores of state congressional delegations, the outcomes of congressional elections, the partisan division of state legislatures, the party of the governor, and various assumptions regarding voters and state political elites. We establish the utility of our indicators for 1960-93 by (i) examining and, whenever possible, testing the assumptions on which they are based, (ii) assessing their reliability, (iii) assessing their convergent validity by correlating them with other ideology indicators, and (iv) appraising their construct validity by analyzing their predictive power within multivariate models from some of the best recent research in the state politics field. Strongly supportive results from each battery of tests indicate the validity of our annual, state-level measures of citizen and government ideology. Substantively, our measures reveal more temporal variation in state citizen ideology than is generally recognized.

publicationCitation.value: William D. Berry, Evan J. Ringquist, Richard C. Fording, Russell L. Hanson. 1998. “Measuring Citizen and Government Ideology in the American States, 1960-93.” American Journal of Political Science, Vol. 42, No. 1 (Jan.), pp. 327-348. doi:10.2307/2991759. article available here

fields.value: Subject: STANDARD DEPOSIT TERMS 1.0  Type: DATAPASS:TERMS:STANDARD:1.0  Notes: This study was deposited under the of the Data-PASS standard deposit terms. A copy of the usage agreement is included in the file section of this study.;

value:
Most Recently Updated Measures of Citizen and Government Ideology (Last Updated August, 2007)*

*For information concerning previously released updates of the citizen and government ideology scores (including data requests), please contact Richard Fording, University of Kentucky.

files.label: EWMVALID_DAT.tab

dataFile.description: Construct validity correlations data

files.description: SAS command file for construct validity correlations with WEM measures and Klingman and Lammers policy liberalism measure (see p. 341 of the AJPS article). The correlations of our measures with the Klingman and Lammers' measures produced by this command file are slightly different than those reported in the article, since the former were inadvertently aggregated from 1963-78 instead of 1961-78 as is reported in the text.
files.label: EWMVALID.SAS

dataFile.description: SAS command file for construct validity correlations with WEM measures and Klingman and Lammers policy liberalism measure (see p. 341 of the AJPS article). The correlations of our measures with the Klingman and Lammers' measures produced by this command file are slightly different than those reported in the article, since the former were inadvertently aggregated from 1963-78 instead of 1961-78 as is reported in the text.
